intro: Acrolophia barbata, commonly known as the hairy-headed lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant features a bulbous stem and produces multiple leaves that are narrow and grass-like. Acrolophia barbata thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
